Config.DestinationPattern.Description:
The pattern for creating a destination-path.

Following variables can be used inside this expression:

* `${workspaceFolder}`:  
Either the path to the `workspace` or the directory which contains the document.
* `${dirname}`:  
The relative path from the `${workspaceFolder}` to the directory which contains the document.
* `${basename}`:  
The name of the document-file without extension.
* `${extension}`:  
The file-extension of the destination-datatype.
* `${filename}`: 
The name of the document-file.
Config.IgnoreLanguageMode.Description: `true` to convert the current file even if the language isn't set to Markdown; otherwise `false`.
Config.ConversionQuality.Description: The quality of the rendered file.
Config.ConversionType.Description: Either a single or a set of types to convert the markdown-file to.
Config.Locale.Description:
The `locale` to print the date.

***Note:***  
This option defaults to VSCode's locale.
Config.DefaultDateFormat.Description:
The default format-pattern or name of a date-format to print dates.  
See: <https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/8kb3ddd4(v=vs.110).aspx>
Config.DateFormats.Description: A set of names and and their associated custom date-format.
Config.ChromiumArgs.Description:
A set of arguments to pass to chromium.

This feature might be useful if you want to pass arguments such as `--no-sandbox` to chromium.
Config.Parser.Toc.Enabled.Description: Enables the rendering of a table of contents using `markdown-it-table-of-contents`.
Config.Parser.Toc.Class.Description: The css-class of the table of contents.
Config.Parser.Toc.Levels.Description:
The heading-levels to include into the table of contents.

***Examples:***
`"2-6"`, `"2, 3, 4, 5, 6"`.
Config.Parser.Toc.Indicator.Description: The RegExp that is to be replaced by the table of contents.
Config.Parser.Toc.ListType.Description:
The list-type of the table of contents.
The list can either be numbered (`ol`) or not numbered (`ul`).
Config.Document.Attributes.Description:
The attributes of the document.  
They can be included into the document like this: `{{ AttributeName }}`
Config.Document.Attributes.Author: Author
Config.Document.Attributes.Author.Descri:
The name of the author.

***Note:***
If not defined the name of the current user will be used.
Config.Document.Attributes.Company.Descr: The name of the company of the document.
Config.Document.Paper.PaperFormat.Descri:
The dimensions of the rendered document.  
Either the width and the height of the paper or a predefined format.
The width of the paper.  
Valid units are: `mm`, `cm`, `in`, `px`. No unit means `px`.
Config.Document.Paper.PaperFormat.Height:
The height of the paper.  
Valid units are: `mm', `cm`, `in`, `px`. No unit means `px`.
Config.Document.Paper.Margin.Top.Descrip:
The top margin.  
Valid units are: `mm`, `cm`, `in`, `px`. No unit means `px`
Config.Document.Paper.Margin.Right.Descr:
The right margin.  
Valid units are: `mm`, `cm`, `in`, `px`. No unit means `px`
Config.Document.Paper.Margin.Bottom.Desc:
The bottom margin.  
Valid units are: `mm`, `cm`, `in`, `px`. No unit means `px`
Config.Document.Paper.Margin.Left.Descri:
The left margin.  
Valid units are: `mm`, `cm`, `in`, `px`. No unit means `px`
Config.Document.HeaderFooterEnabled.Desc:
This option enables the rendering of headers and footers.

Note:
Script-tags are not supported inside the header and the footer.
Config.Document.HeaderTemplate.Descripti:
The content of the header or the path to the header-template.  
You can insert the page-number and the total amount of pages by using the CSS-classes `pageNumber` and `totalPages`.
Config.Document.FooterTemplate.Descripti: The content of the footer or the path to the footer-template.
Config.Document.Design.Template.Descript:
The path to the template of the document.

***Note:***  
  - `{{{styles}}}`'s replaced by the css-styles
  - `{{{content}}}`'s replaced by the body of the document.
Config.Document.Design.DefaultStyles.Des: Allows you to disable the default styles.
Config.Document.Design.StyleSheets.Descr:
Stylesheets to include in the document.  
They can either be a local path or an URI.
